dt: {bc}to form into a disk or circle

shortdef: to form into a disk or circle

dt: {bc}any of the concentric spheres in old astronomy surrounding the earth and carrying the celestial bodies in their revolutions
{bc}a sphere surmounted by a cross symbolizing kingly power and justice

et: Middle English, borrowed from Middle French & Latin; Middle French {it}orbe,{/it} borrowed from Latin {it}orbis{/it} "disk, circle, sphere, orbit," perhaps a derivative of an Indo-European verbal base {it}*h{inf}3{/inf}erbh-{/it} "turn, be turned over, undergo transfer," whence also Tocharian B {it}yerpe{/it} "disk," Hittite {it}harp-{/it} "change sides, change allegiance"
shortdef: any of the concentric spheres in old astronomy surrounding the earth and carrying the celestial bodies in their revolutions
a spherical body; especially : a spherical celestial object
